replies.author: suleka96

replies.bodyText:
They are not iterable so I didn't not create iteration return types or write type param logic for them.

xml:Element also isn't iterable, right? But there's a XML_ITR_NEXT_RETURN_ELEMENT_TYPE?
These are the record value types for iterator next right?
We can iterate xml, xml<T>, and xml:Text.
So I assume we will need record values with all of the following field types

xml:Element|xml:Text|xml:ProcessingInstruction|xml:Comment
xml:Element
xml:Text
xml:ProcessingInstruction
xml:Comment
and other combinations of unions of these (e.g., xml:Comment|xml:Element for xml<xml:Comment|xml:Element>).

Thus my question re: why we don't need the others. How do we handle the union case btw?
replies.author: MaryamZi
suleka96
MaryamZi

replies.bodyText: As we discussed xml<xml:Comment> and xml<xml:ProcessingInstruction> is now iterable. Also regarding unions, we are unable to write a xml union sequence with lang capabilities at the moment. However, after discussing with @rdhananjaya,  instead of switching from 'BXml' types it is now switched from the 'xml value type' so a union case won't exist now.
